143132221232212.content:
Aggie then quickly pivoted her body on one foot, facing her back towards Stinky, and poking her butt out towards her. Stinky's eyes widened almost immediately, as she knew exactly what to expect from a gesture like that. So, she closed her eyes and closed her mouth as she tucked her body into a tight ball and rolled herself away from the wall she was sitting up against, just in time to miss Aggie's large, powerful fart.

BRRRRRRRRRMMMMMMPPPPPPPPTTT!!

After Aggie farted, Stinky stopped rolling, and uncurled her body, landing on both her feet and one hand - without even really processing it, Stinky was more agile than she was normally.

"Hey, what the hell, man?" Stinky said at Aggie. "This how you say hello to everybody?" Aggie then stood up straight and turned to face Stinky, all while giggling to herself. She put her hand on her hip and replied, "Only to the Stinkers, if you just gotta know."

"Well, thanks for at least telling me your name first, before you just shoved your butt in my direction," Stinky responded, with a sarcastic smirk. Aggie exclaimed, "Oooooo, fiery - I like that in a competitor!" Stinky stood up on both her feet, after pushing herself up off the hand she was putting her weight onto. "Y'know, if you just wanted a fart-off, you coulda just asked," Stinky stated.

"Yeah, but that wouldn't be much fun," Aggie replied. "Where's the fun in out-farting another Stinker if they're expecting it? Rather catch them off-guard and surprise them!" Stinky just chuckled, "Yeah, well then try and not announce yourself first, dumbass." Aggie's face shifted to a more annoyed expression. "Hey now, that's rude," she replied. "No need for that."

"Yeah, well sorry, not sorry," Stinky said directly. "I'm in a bad mood, and I don't plan on just entertaining you right now - you wanna fart-off, then tell me what time and place you want, but not today, OK?" Aggie just stood there in silence, as if she was trying to get a read on Stinky. After a few seconds, she sat down and spread her legs in a casual fashion, and replied, "Alright, alright - clearly sis pissed ya off. I won't add any more fuel to that fire." Stinky crossed her arms and asked, "Who the hell is your sis, anyway? You say that like I should know who that is."

"Right, shoulda figured she didn't tell ya about me," Aggie responded. "I meant Beverly - y'know, the girl in the library you were just with." Stinky's eyes widened. "Wait, you were there?" Aggie nodded, then continued, "I saw you storm out of the entrance, and she was following behind ya - guess she musta pissed you off again, huh?" Stinky just looked away and said quietly, "Yeah, you can say that..." before turning back to face Aggie and asking, "So, she's your sister?" Aggie nodded once more.

"Well, more like my step-sister," she clarified. "My dad married her mom, that sorta thing."

"TMI," Stinky said bluntly. "I don't really care about all that."

Aggie just laughed, rather loudly. "Hahahahaha! I like your style! You always like this?" Stinky shrugged. "Only when I'm having a bad day," she replied. Aggie paused for a moment before saying, "Yeah, I was gonna say - I didn't recognize ya at first, what with you being so teeny-tiny now." Stinky put her hands on her hips and said, "Hey, back off, alright? This whole thing is none of your business."

"Well, I'm just saying, it's not like happens everyday," Aggie said with a smile. "So, where were we?"

Stinky put her hands in her pockets. "You wanted a fart-off. I'm telling you, I'm in no mood for one." Aggie got up on one knee as she said, "Well, I think you're forgetting something... I didn't ask for one to begin with."

Aggie then lunged her body towards Stinky, mouth closed and cheeks puffed. Stinky stumbled back in shock. What the hell?! she thought. What is WITH this girl? Once Aggie was about a foot away from Stinky's face, she let out a large belch.

"*BUUUURRRRAAAAP!*"

As Aggie flopped her body on the ground in front of Stinky, Stinky instinctively covered her nose. A Belcher AND a Farter, huh? she said to herself. Guess this girl likes to go all out - no rules, no holds-barred, either. This isn't the kinda competition I'm used to - it's more like a straight up fight! Stinky then looked down at Aggie, face down in front of her on the ground, and thought, Well, two can play at that game! Still covering her mouth, Stinky turned her back towards Aggie, then proceeded to unleash a large fart.

BBRRRRRAAAAAAAAPPPPPPPPT!

It was large and powerful enough to push Aggie away, but without lifting her off the ground. Stinky uncovered her face and deiced to make a break for it - she ran pretty fast before earlier, so she figured she could get away from Aggie that way. Without much more thought, Stinky made a dash in front of her, away from Aggie, who was just starting to get up off the ground.

"Hey, get back here!" Aggie shouted at Stinky from behind. "We were just getting started!" Stinky didn't say anything, and only proceeded to run, all while she heard Aggie's voice grow quiet behind her. "This isn't the end of this, Stinky! I'll find you, and we will finish this today, you hear me? One of us is gonna knock the other out, and it's gonna be me!"

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------

Time: 8:31 AM

Stinky just kept running and running, her mind racing from everything that had just happened. Ugh, why did today have to be such a pain in the ass? she thought. First Bev, no this Aggie girl? Not to mention I'm a total shrimp now - how could this get any worse?

Just then, while lost in her thoughts, Stinky ran into someone, bumping into their leg, and falling back down on her butt. "Oh, come on!" she shouted. "Can't you just look where you're going?!"

"Stinky?" said the person she ran into. Stinky then looked up to see that the person she ran into was:

Stinky looked up to see that the person she ran into was actually Sam, her best friend. Sam looked down at Stinky and asked, "Stinky, are you OK?" Stinky paused for a bit, before getting back up on her feet. "Oh, Sam!" she replied. "Uh, yeah, I'm fine, just--"

"Why are you so short?" Sam interrupted. Stinky just shook her head and said, "Oh, don't worry about it - this will wear off in, like, a few hours." Sam stood there and stared. "Wait, how do you kno-- actually, forget it," Sam stated. "What happened? Sounds like something's got you upset." Stinky put her hands in her pockets and looked up at Sam. "I, uh... I don't wanna talk about it right now, Sam - just, not right now." Sam didn't say anything for a few seconds, then nodded silently. "OK... but, when you do feel like it, you can tell me, alright? I just wanna make sure you're doing good." Stinky chuckled, "I know, Sam - you always say that." Sam laughed back, "Well, I always mean it."

The two decided to walk next to each other - Sam told Stinky that he was going towards their hideout in the woods just on the outskirts of town, hoping to meet Stinky there, since she wasn't at home. Stinky didn't have anywhere else she wanted to go, and she felt better being away from the plaza for the time being - away from Beverly and Aggie.

The two carried on with light conversation, before Sam asked, "So, mind telling me why you're so short?" Stinky just sighed, and smiled back at Sam. "Yeah, I guess I better tell ya, huh?" she replied. "You're gonna think this was stupid - and it was - but I found this bottle on the ground and decided to drink what was in it." Sam couldn't help but chuckle. "Couldn't help yourself, huh?" I didn't find out until after the fact that the bottle said Shrink Drink on it."

"Ouch. Would have been a good idea to read that first," Sam said, jokingly. Stinky just looked up at Sam with a raised eyebrow and said, "I know, but... whatever, can't change it now." Sam replied, "Yeah, fair enough - I assume the bottle was labeled though. Did it also say how long it would last?" Stinky nodded. "Six whole hours - I drank the thing like an hour ago, so I guess it's just five hours now."

"And you just found it, lying on the ground?" Sam asked. Stinky gave Sam a confused expression. "Yeah, why?" Sam then stopped in his tracks, Stinky stopping shortly after. "Oh yeah... that's a good point. That didn't even hit me until just now." Sam put his hands on his sides and remarked, "Well, what would you do without me?" with a sarcastic smile. "I thought you were always down for this kinda stuff - going on adventures. What's gotten into you today?" Stinky paused for a moment before she said, "Well... ah hell, I dunno. You're right, that does sound like a fun idea." Sam smiled at Stinky. "That's good to hear - so, we should start looking for clues, then. Did the label say anything else on it? Like, where it could have come from?"

"I dunno - I don't even have the bottle right now," Stinky replied. Sam scratched his head and said, "Alright, great start - do you at least remember where you found it?"

Stinky rubbed her hand on her chin. Let's see... she thought. I was walking down the sidewalk by my house, and that's when I saw Bev. Bev showed me the labeled and... after that, I forget. Did she just put it back, or did she keep it?

Just slap her awake." Belchie shook her head. "No, Aggie, I'm not doing that." Aggie just rolled her eyes, replied, "Fiiiine, I'll do it," then walked up towards Belchie and knelt down next to her. Before Belchie could respond, Aggie swiftly slapped Stinky's face, just hard enough to jolt her awake.

Stinky's eyes flashed open, and she quickly sat up. "Whoa..." she said softly. She turned to Belchie and asked, "Bev, what happened? Was I out long?" Belchie paused, then shook her head. "No," she assured, "you were only out for about a minute or so - you sorta, well, knocked yourself out." Stinky's eyebrows shot up. "What?! Now way, you can't be serious! Look, it was some pretty bad gas, but it was not that bad - how could it knock me out?"

Aggie just snickered to herself. "Oh, this is priceless," she exclaimed. "First you're a newborn midget, and now you knock yourself out with your own farts - you're really off your game today, huh?" Stinky immediately shifted her gaze towards Aggie and replied, "Oh, shut up! I don't need you butting in! What do you even want, anyway, a rematch? I already told ya, I am. Not. Interested."

Aggie threw her hands up in front of her and said back, "Hey-hey, slow your roll there, little buddy - I'm not here for a rematch. Honestly, even if I was, it wouldn't be satisfying - I wanna try and beat ya at your best, and with you having a hard time with your own gas? Forget it." Belchie and Stinky both looked confused - they both turned to face each other, one eye brow raised. They turned back to face Aggie, and then Belchie asked, "So, then what are you here for?"

Aggie stood straight up and looked down at both of the girls sitting on the ground in front of her. "Simple: I wanna help."

Stinky's eyes widened. "Help? With what, this? Listen, this is only temporary, and it'll wear off, so if you don't mind, can you just leave--" but before she could finish, Aggie interrupted her and continued, "I know that, pipsqueak, but lemme explain!" Aggie sighed and then extended an open hand towards Belchie. "Sis, can you hand me that bottle?" Belchie took the bottle out of her bag and placed it in Aggie's hand. Aggie then raised the bottle up next to her face.

"Alright, listen up - I know the guy who makes these lil' potions here. I can hook you up with him, and he can give you something that should help ya get back to normal in no time." Stinky got up and stood straight, a skeptical look on her face. "Wait, seriously? You know the guy who made that?" Aggie nodded. "Yeah, name's Chemsy Elttob - weird name, I know - he's a weird old kook who lives somewhere deep in the alleyways. Real back-alley stuff, that's where his store is." Belchie stood up and stepped towards Aggie, and asked directly, "Why do you work for some weirdo who works out of some alley?!"

"Sis, calm down, it's nothing serious," Aggie assured. "His stuff doesn't hurt ya, it just does weird things to ya - doctors just don't like it, because they don't understand it." Belchie narrowed her eyes and replied, "That the pitch he gave ya?" Aggie rolled her eyes. "Yes, but I also know from trying it out myself - it's thanks to him, I get access to drinks that give me and my gas a little... boost, you could say." Belchie couldn't believe what she was hearing. "Sis, you tried that stuff?!"

"Like I said, it doesn't hurt ya!" Aggie yelled back. "Besides, don't take my word for it, take Stinky's here. Yeah she's having a couple o'side effects, but she's fine otherwise. Listen, not my point." Aggie continued, this time turning to face Stinky. "I can bring ya over to Chemsy, and I'll ask him if he can give ya something to reverse the effects of whatever you drank, alright? If I show him the bottle, he should know what to do." Stinky put her hands on her hips. "OK... but what do you want in exchange?" Aggie smiled. "Hey, you catch on quick - alright, I'll tell it to ya straight: I'm not just gonna do this for free. You don't gotta pay me, but I'm gonna ask you to return the favor - after I take ya to Chemsy, you and me, we gotta have our rematch."

Stinky nodded, "Yeah, that's about what I expected." Aggie laughed and replied, "Well, hey, at least we're on the same page!" Belchie interjected, "Well, that's stupid! This effect will wear off in a few hours anyway, right? She can just wait that long, and not have to bother with you." Aggie waved her finger and replied, "Not your choice to make, sis - that's up to our little friend here."

"Can you please stop calling me 'little,' already? Gets on my nerves," Stinky stated. She then put her hand on her chin, and gave it some thought. Hmmmm. Let's see, what do I wanna do?
1431322212322123121131212.title: Aggie Appears, Once Again!

choices: Stinky replies, "Aggie said you may have something that can help me"
14313222123221231211312121.content:
After thinking over Aggie's offer some, Stinky just silently nodded her head and replied, "Alright, Aggie - I'll accept your offer, but only if he really can help! I'm not gonna let you drag my butt to some alley for nothing." Aggie just chuckled, and said back to Stinky, "Fair enough, short stuff! We can settle the terms of our rematch after Chemsy's done helping ya out. Now, follow me!"

Without a hitch, Aggie quickly turned her body right around and then started walking away from Belchie and Stinky, who quickly followed behind her. "Just don't gas us out before we get there, OK?" Belchie said. Aggie looked over her shoulder and responded, "Wouldn't dream of it - I'm holding it in just fine. Wanna make sure my tank's full for the duel."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------

Time: 9:42 AM

The time it took to get to where Aggie was leading Stinky and Belchie took longer than Stinky expected - the walk from the gym to Chemsy's alley shop took over a half-hour so far. During the walk, Aggie and Belchie would bicker among themselves - it consisted mostly of Belchie bemoaning Aggie for working for such a strange individual, and Aggie arguing back that nothing happened, among other things the two would argue about.

Stinky didn't involve herself in those conversations, and just kept quiet - she figured getting involved would just lead to nothing but headaches. One thing she did notice was how Aggie wasn't so much as tooting at all - no belches, either. Huh, she thought to herself, guess Aggie's serious about me going up against her - I just hope she isn't just making this guy up just to knock me out in some alleyway... actually, whose to say that's NOT what's she's doing? Maybe this is all a trap or something. I should probably ask her for some details about this guy.

Stinky finally spoke up for the first time since the three girls started their walk, and asked Aggie, "Hey, Agg - this Chemsy guy... what's he like?" Aggie just looked over her shoulder at Stinky and replied, "Care to elaborate?" Stinky took her hands out of her pockets and put them on her hips. "Look, I've never met this guy before - clearly you know more about him than I do, so I'd like to know what's he's like before I meet him." Aggie paused, then smirked. "Yeah, OK - I should letcha know what the geezer's like. Well, to start, I call him a geezer, but the old fart's not really that old - he's like 60-something, if I had to take a guess. He's tall, scrawny, and has a scar on his right eye, underneath an eye-patch."

"An eyepatch?" Stinky questioned. "He sounds like some sorta pirate - he got a peg leg too?" Aggie just laughed. "No, no, no peg leg - no funny hat, either. Just the eye-patch. He does have short, shaggy hair, and a mustache though. Oh yeah, and he also wears a robe, like, all the time." Stinky paused, then continued asking, "OK, so is he a doctor or something? How'd he start getting into making weird potions?"

"Actually, he never told me," Aggie said bluntly. "I wanted to know that too, but he told me it was some secret." Stinky started thinking to herself, Well, THAT'S suspicious.

"How did you meet this guy, anyway?" Stinky asked. Aggie paused for several seconds before she responded, "Well, I'd rather he'd tell ya - it's too embarrassing for me to say." Stinky stopped walking and then yelled, "Oh, that's convenient!" Belchie and Aggie both stopped and turned to face Stinky, with Aggie replying, "What's your problem?"

"My problem is that I'm not even sure this Chemsy guy is legit!" Stinky exclaimed. "It's awfully strange how there's this guy in some alley who knows exactly what to do to cure my little height problem, and you would know where we can find him, isn't it?" Belchie then turned to Aggie and said, "Yeah... not to mention, Stinky just found that bottle on the sidewalk. How do you explain that?" Aggie looked surprised. "Sidewalk? Where, which sidewalk?"

"The sidewalk by my house," Stinky replied. "I was taking a walk, and that's when I found it, just lying there." Aggie's eyebrows shot up. "Wait," she said, "Where is your house?" Stinky just raised an eyebrow and replied, "Over by Bluestream Street - why?" Almost immediately after that response, Aggie's eyes widened, and she shouted, "Ohhhh, shit! THAT'S why I couldn't find it! I thought I just forgot to grab it, like some idiot!" Stinky and Belchie reeled back slightly, both shocked at Aggie's reaction. Belchie asked, "Aggie, what's going on?" Aggie took a deep breath and replied, "I was making a delivery to one of Chemsy's customers - my route went past there, on Bluestream. I put my box down for a minute, so I could get some pebbles outta my shoe, and right when I was about to pick it up, some stupid kid knocked the box over while he was riding his skateboard!" Aggie paused to take another deep breath, before she continued, "I thought I got all of them back in there, but by the time I met up with the customer, he said there was one missing! I tried going back to look for it where that kicked knocked it all over, but there was nothing there - so you're saying that was you?"

Stinky nodded and said, "Yeah, I guess it was me." Aggie put her hands on her face, and couldn't help but push out a large fart in frustration.

BBBRRRRR-BBBRRRAAAAAP!

"Great!" she shouted. "Now Chemsy's gonna chew me out for this too... ugh, whatever - once we get there, I'll explain what happened, and you can tell your side of the story. Right now, I just wanna get there, and get this over with."

Aggie turned and starting walking, but this time, she started farting again - she clearly stopped caring about holding it in after that. Stinky and Belchie just followed far behind Aggie, without saying another word.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------

Time: 9:59 AM

The three girls finally made their way to the alleyway Aggie had mentioned - it was between a drugstore and a laundromat, but continued down past them for several feet. Aggie stopped and said, "Alright, we're here - I'll go on ahead, since I know the code, and then you three can enter after me." Stinky and Belchie just nodded, and followed after Aggie. After entering the alleyway, they continued up until they reached and right turn, which Aggie took without a second thought. Continuing farther down the alleyway, at the end was a single door, with a keypad on it - Aggie went up to it and started punching in the number combination right away. After a click and a beep followed suit, she opened the door, and motioned the two others to go inside. Once Stinky and Belchie entered the door, Aggie followed, and closed it behind them. The room the girls found themselves in was bigger than they thought it would be, but well lit, thanks to both the fluorescent bulbs, and the sunlight peering through the blinds on the windows.

It was just them, however - no sign of this Chemsy character. Stinky was just about to ask where he was, but that was when Aggie belched loudly.

"*UUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPP!*"

Stinky quickly turned and asked, "What did you do that for?" Aggie snickered and replied, "Oh yeah, that's how I let the old man know it's me." Right after her response, the three girls heard shuffling coming from another room, followed by the sounds of footsteps entering.

"Ahhhh, Aggie!" said the man who had walked in. "What are you doing here? ...Who are these two? They your friends?"

Stinky couldn't believe it at first, but the man in front of her matched the description Aggie gave almost perfectly - a tall, scrawny, 60-year-old man with a scar one his right eye, obscured somewhat by an eyepatch. He was also wearing a large, white short sleeved t-shirt that was clearly too big for him, with a design that looked like a cartoon dog, and some jeans. No shoes or socks, though, just barefoot.

"Hey there, Chem," Aggie replied. "These two are Stinky and Beverly - Bev's my sister, and Stinky's the pipsqueak." Stinky immediately turned her head upwards to look back at Aggie and respond, "Hey, I said quit it with the short comments, alright?"

Chemsy replied, "What made you bring them here? This better be important!" Aggie stepped up and said, "It is, Chem, I promise - so, Stinky here, she's actually the one who drank your Shrink Drink. Remember when I said I lost it? Well, she found it and drank it." Chemsy paused, and them looked down at Stinky. He took a few moments before replying, "Well... at least I know now that it works." He knelt down and asked Stinky, "Any side effects there, young lady?" Stinky just shrugged her shoulders and said, "Eh, just some gas, but, that';s nothing new for me."

Chemsy chuckled under his breath. "Alright, well there's that mystery solved - and here I thought it had been stolen! Thank you for telling me this, Aggie, but you really need to be more careful next time." Aggie just nodded her head.

Chemsy added, "So, what brings you all here to my humble little Potion Shoppe?"
14313222123221231211312121.title: Chemsy Elttob

choices: The Library - she wanted to see what books they had in there
The Post Office - she was expecting a certain delivery
The Arcade - she wanted to play some games
Balloon Belly Burger - she was still hungry after breakfast
The Strip Mall - she wanted to see what stores there were there
15.content:
As she strolled down the sidewalk, nothing remarkable occurred whatsoever. Stinky simply continued her walk in peace.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------

Time: 7:27 AM

Stinky ended up in the downtown area - she took a look around too see what was around her. To her right, there the library and the post office right next to each other, and across the street from those was the arcade. To her left, Stinky saw Balloon Belly Burger, her favorite burger joint, and lastly, a few yards in front of her was the strip mall.

Where did Stinky go?
15.title: Downtown

info.brief_description: This is the story of a young, 11-year-old tomboy named Elueze Robins, AKA "Stinky."
info.description:
Thank you for reading and taking part in this Interactive Story - this is an idea I've had for some time, about a character that I came up with back in Middle School. This is the premise:

Elueze Robins is an 11-year-old girl who happens to be a Stinker - a Stinker is someone born with the strange ability to produce and control their own natural gas. Elueze loves having this ability, as she uses it to not only fart at will, but to also do other things with her gas as well - because of this, she's more commonly known in her hometown as "Stinky."

Stinky is an out-and-proud tomboy, and makes that known to whoever she meets. Stinky is energetic and often crude, but she is also open and friendly - she's the kind of girl who knows exactly who she is, and doesn't care to hide it.

Stinky is the central character of this story, but she is not the only key character - there are both of her parents, her best friend, and finally, her rival.

Stinky's mother is Helena Robins, and her father is Johnathon Robins. The two have been married for 13 years, and Stinky is their only child. Helena stays at home to help clean the house and take care of Stinky, while Johnathon works as a police officer during the day. Stinky's relationship with both of her parents is happy and healthy, but they are not without their occasional fights - Helena in particular is sometimes hard on Stinky for being too excessive with her farting. As for Johnathon, he disciplines his daughter as best he can, but he's still there for Stinky when she needs him most.

Stinky's best friend is a 12-year-old boy named Samuel Rosio. Sam's mother and biological father separated years ago, and Sam doesn't even remember what his father looks like. Thankfully, he and his mom are not alone - Sam's mother, Allison, married a Hispanic man named Julian, hence Sam's last name being Rosio. Sam and Stinky have known each other since they were toddlers, and get along well, despite how different they are from each other - unlike Stinky, Sam is more calm and polite than her, and will occasionally point out when she's being a bit too much. He's also more sarcastic than Stinky is on average, resulting in Sam coming of as occasionally jaded, but still a very overall happy boy. Sam and Stinky care for each other very much, and neither of them can imagine what their lives would be like without the other in it.

Finally, there's Dylan Gasser, Stinky's rival - Dylan is also 11 years old, though he is not a Stinker like Stinky is, but that doesn't stop him from trying to out-gas her at every opportunity, doing what he can to make himself fart as much as possible. Dylan is much more snarky than Stinky is, and also more competitive, but also driven and determined when he sets his mind to something. Dylan and Stinky may not get along quite as well as she and Sam do, but they still maintain a friendly rivalry with each other all the same.

As for other characters, that's up to you to decide - during this one day in Stinky's life, you can give her the chance to meet all sorts of new people she had never seen before, or establish relationships with people in her hometown I never even considered. As the story begins, Stinky will start off the day like normal, but through of choices you make as you read, you can have Stinky go on one of many different kinds of crazy adventures! Keep in mind, each of these stories must take place within one day, and once that day is up, the story must end. what happened the day before, or what will happen the day after are not a factor here - this day in Stinky's life is an isolated moment, where anything can happen!

ATTENTION: This story is rated 13+ - while some language and mild suggestive elements are allowed, absolutely NO SEXUAL CONTENT is permitted. The main character of this story is only a child, and thus, any chapter submitted that results in her doing something sexual in nature will be removed. Other questionable content will be removed per my discretion - this story is not at all intended to be something that pertains to a certain fetish or kink, but something light-hearted, fun, and dumb. Feel free to read if you wish, but if you want to add your own chapters to this story, please respect and adhere to these strict guidelines. Anything else is fair game.

I will make the occasional edit, either in regards to spelling or grammatical errors, as well as small changes in dialogue so that each character stays in-character, as much as possible. With that said, thank you taking the time to read this outline, and please enjoy A Day in the Life of Stinky!
info.pretty_title: A Day in the Life of Stinky
